item.title: Know the local laws
item.content: Understand the legal status of marijuana in your jurisdiction. Be aware of the amount you are legally allowed to carry. Know the difference between medical and recreational possession where applicable.

item.title: Carrying marijuana
item.content: Carry it in a closed, non-accessible container when traveling. Have your medical marijuana card with you if you are a registered patient. Be aware of the areas where possession is illegal (e.g., federal lands, schools, certain public places).

item.title: Use of marijuana
item.content: Do not use marijuana in public places unless explicitly allowed by local law. Avoid driving or operating heavy machinery after using marijuana.

item.title: Medical use
item.content: Always have your documentation ready if youâ€™re a medical user. Be familiar with your rights to use, possess, and possibly grow marijuana for medical purposes.

item.title: Interacting with the police
item.content: If stopped by police, be polite and respectful. You are not required to consent to a search unless the officer has a warrant or probable cause. Know your rights but also understand the potential consequences of asserting those rights (See "Legislation and Rights" below).

item.title: Detained or Arrested
item.content: Stay calm and do not resist. You have the right to remain silent and the right to an attorney. Do not provide any details or admit to anything regarding your marijuana use or possession until you have legal representation.
